Reviews.Title: “Service is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in mid February of this year for four nights. We were on the tail end of a 5 week tour of Italy.(plus 3 nights in Paris). We were impressed from the very start. The door was opened for us and check in was friendly and efficient. We booked a JNR suite and it was superb, it had an amazing view of the canal, the bed comfortable and top quality linen. The decor is out of a designer magazine but still homely. Breakfast was excellent, fresh and ample choice. Location is great and just that little bit out of the hustle and bustle to ensure a quiet nights sleep. But above all what makes this hotel our favorite of our trip is the Staff. This is without exception from bell boy to front desk staff day and night. They were all excellent. Helping us with flights, dinner and arranging a surprise gondola ride and dinner for my partner. Well done Aqua Palace you made our last four nights in Italy unforgettable for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Gadabout2210
Reviews.Content: Well 4th city on our Europe trip and Aqua Palace certainly ticked all the boxes. We had booked a junior suite with canal view,though as we were on the 1st floor we probably didn't really get the views we imagined. With the windows open we certainly heard the thousand of tourists that pass by and the garbage truck that arrives at 7am each morning,however that all added to our experience! The room was divine,huge with a separate lounge area which we made good use of! Bathroom was huge and amenities and toiletries excellent. Breakfast,well after our last hotel we were a bit wary but the aqua palace came up trumps. Choices were amazing and though small we went at different times on our 3 mornings and always were accommodated. All in all an excellent choice in Venice and once you find your way around so easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JEFandPG
Reviews.Content: Checked out the reviews of various hotels in Venice and decided on this one. Really pleased we did as we could not find fault with this small boutique style hotel. Well sited approx mid-way between the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square - both of which were only a few minutes walk away once we eventually familiarised ourselves with the 'rabbit warren' of passageways and streets that is Venice! Tip:- If arriving by water bus then get off at Rialto Bridge, walk into into the passage ways directly at the end of the bridge, 'dog leg' left and right across the square, go down another passage(s), and cross the next canal; keep going and after you pass another small square on your left look for a sign for Hotel Caneletto on your right ; the Aqua Palace is very close by! (Better still get a good map!) We were not so well informed and nearly got hopelessly lost trying to find the hotel as dusk was falling - nearly resorted to finding a water taxi to take us there! The hotel was lovely, clean, and comfortable; the staff/customer service was excellent. We had a standard double room that overlooked a small quiet square at the back of the hotel but it was spacious, and had a lovely large bathroom. Free wi-fi was available at all times. Outside the room was a very nice landing with seating, and a balcony that overlooked a canal. A comfortable area to relax in. There was no formal restaurant in the hotel - just a small well presented breakfast room - never crowded tho'. This wasn't a problem as eating out was easy in Venice - loads of restaurants but you might need 'deep pockets' All we can say is - this hotel was a fantastic find and we would strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Venice...and I'm picky!”
Reviews.Author: jillsy
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at Aqua Palace. The location is very convenient to all the sights. The room was very nice and able to accommodate my family of four. Breakfast was good, the only draw back was that the area was small and sometimes we had to wait for a table.The hostess in charge of breakfast was really very sweet and always tried to accommodate us as quickly as possible. Some of the staff at the front desk were very welcoming, friendly and helpful, some not as much but overall a good experience. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: SearsLeicester
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice in December 2011 for my 40th birthday and stayed 2 nights at The Aqua Palace Hotel. On arrival our room was upgraded to a Junior Suite with fantastic views of the canals. The room was large with lovely bathroom. The hotel is centrally located making it ideal for visiting both St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge areas. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast was ideal. We found some very nice restaurants out of the tourist areas. A fantastic weekend, would definitely recommend the hotel and hopefully will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: hebedee73
Reviews.Content: Most other reviews describe the hotel accurately in terms of decoration. We paid for a junior suite and were very pleased with our one night stay. Breakfast was wonderful, one of the only 4 star hotels we stayed in with fresh orange juice! The room was fantastic, quality furnishings have been used, curtains etc are amazing quality and the bathroom is a joy to wash in, double shower and basins, Amazing views. As for the morning noise it was only a one night stay so I can't comment as to how annoying it would be several mornings in a row but my partner and I got great joy from watching the morning daily life outside the hotel. The laundry being collected and delivered, the water bottles being delivered, recycling collection and so on. It is a part of life in Venice that businesses have to have their deliveries and made it more special for us but if it will disturb you I would suggest a hotel room away from the water. Lovely location near to Rialto and St Marks. My advice would be to approach hotel from St Marks as it is a nicer walk. We did both directions several times and the alleys coming from Rialto are harder to locate on the map and quieter. Venice is a safe city but it is still more pleasant arriving to the hotel from St Marks in my opinion. We had little contact with the desk staff as we had planned some trips in advance, but the contact we did have was courteous and professional. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending the hotel to other travellers for a central location with a canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: A V
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this place for a Venice city trip. It has excellent service, very kind staff, a very good breakfast buffet (although the breakfast area isn't that big, so we had to wait for a table twice, but enjoyed some tea in the meantime) and a nice, intimate and refreshingly quiet atmosphere in a touristic town such as Venice. It is nicely decorated, well-preserved and it's very well situated (once you found it...) for exploring Venice. A tiny minus would be the daily noise of the "garbage boat" in the morning when you're in a canal view room (so what's to complain about really...) - but that's part of the charm of the Venice water life, I guess!

Reviews.Title: “best choice for staying in venice”
Reviews.Author: sara k
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,great staff,great location. We really enjoyed staying 4 nights in Aquapalace.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent Aqua Palace”
Reviews.Author: Thorpedo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqua Palace for 1 night at the end of March and had a very pleasant stay. The location is as good as you will get in Venice, halfway between St Marks and the Rialto (less than 5 mins walk to each) but far enough away from each to be quiet and relaxing. Check in was very efficient. When we reserved the room online through an online agent it only showed twin rooms available but on check in they offered to convert the bed to a double whilst we were sightseeing. When making the booking we had also requested a canal view which they accommodated. Our room was number 91 which is on the ground floor just around the corner from reception and next to the water taxi boarding area, and as such we thought it could be noisy, but didn't hear a thing during the stay so this wasn't an issue. The room was clean and spacious, but we would describe it as opulent rather than contemporary as it is marketed - lots of gold colouring! Whilst this was not entirely to our modern taste, it is as close as we think we could get in Venice. The beds weren't the most comfortable we've ever had as they seemed a bit springy but we still slept well. The room had all the essentials including safe, bathroom amenities kit, free Wi-fi (reception will give you the login details), LCD TV and mini bar. The mini bar itself did seem relatively expensive but there was a complimentary bottle of water. Breakfast was buffet style between 7-10.30am and offered the usual selection of cereals, pastries, yoghurts, cold meats and cheeses along with scrambled eggs and bacon. Everything was of decent quality, and the lady in charge was very friendly. She offered hot drinks and was on hand for anything else that was needed. We arrived at around 9.30 and were seated immediately, although a couple who arrived shortly after us did have a 5 minute wait for a table to become free - they were given tea and coffee whilst waiting though. Check out was at 12pm and was as efficient as check in. The hotel also have a luggage area where you can store bags whilst sightseeing if you aren't leaving the city until later in the day. Overall whilst there were a couple of points which stop me giving 5 (springy bed, type of furnishing and lack of bar / additional facilities), I would still highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Venetian Palace...just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa210
Reviews.Content: Don't look any further...this is it!!! The moment you arrive you are treated to the dream Venetian experience in every way. We had a gorgeous junior canal suite, huge luxurious room with 2 windows looking out onto the small canal below. Large white marble bathroom with double basins, all spotlessly clean. Seriously, we couldn't fault this place! We decided to splurge & arrive by private water taxi, (book online direct for the best rates), we walked straight in from the canal, through the grand doors, a real wow factor! Can't believe their rates are so reasonable considering their location close to both St Marco & Rialto. A fabulous lady, Sylvia, takes care of everyone at breakfast. We heard her speaking fluently in at least 5 languages & she had a great sense of humour as well as making the best cappuccino we had our whole 3 weeks in Italy! Simply the most romantic, stunning place to stay in Venice...book it, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Norazreen
Reviews.Content: If you are in Venice, this has got to be the hotel to stay in. Excellent service - you are greeted with warmly welcome everytime you step into the hotel from your travels. Breakfast with Bindi pies and quality crossaint was delicious and made my every morning. I told them I was on honeymoon and they upgraded me to a junior suite was so luxurious n comfortable and was overlooking the canal - how romantic it was! I truly enjoyed my stay here and it is truly perfect! Thanks to the staff in Aqua Palace Venice for making my honeymoon just perfect! :)

Reviews.Title: “5 star service for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyseco
Reviews.Content: Nothing but praises. Great service. Spectacular rooms. Between san marco and realto.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Gadabouts95
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say about this hotel is that it is in the perfect location just 5-10 minutes from Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square in either direction (depending on how many shop windows you stop to look in!) We had a room right at the top of the hotel, overlooking a canal (if you put your head out of the window). It was comfortable, well decorated and had much more character than a chain hotel. Breakfasts here are excellent with a very wide choice of cereal, juice, fruit, cold selection and bacon and scrambled eggs. Sylvia will greet you every morning and look after you well, and is always keen to have a chat with you. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a slight problem with the return water taxi we had booked, the company did not send a fax confirming the pick up time for the return to the airport and the reception staff kept trying until they got a response. Incidentally, I would still recommend the water taxi company - Venicelink, as they offered one of the cheapest private water taxi services. Pay the extra 40 Euros for arrival via the Grand Canal - worth every cent! When you are in Venice you want to make the most of your time there and so location is important. The Aqua Palace not only has the location but is also a beautifully modernised hotel with great staff. The only place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Aqua Palace hotel, Venice”
Reviews.Author: NSW001
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and quite modern for a hotel in Venice. It has been recently renovated to a good standard. The staff were all very helpful and courteous. Special mention for Sylvia, the lady incharge of the breakfast room who was excellent. The hotel is coveniently located in a central position and allows you to walk to most destinations. Will be happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rebelricky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights, 19th - 23rd March. The location is about half way between Rialto and San Marco, perfect for walking to all the main tourist areas. We had a junior suite which was a good size, clean and with a large bathroom. They provide free wi-fi - which worked very well and and an in room safe. Breakfast was continental style with cold meats, cheeses and also hot option of scrambled eggs, bacon and frankfurters. We found the staff to be very pleasant, especially at breakfast time. We would be more than happy to stay here again if we ever return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing hotel in middle of busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: RamonT1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend and it was a real delight. Helpful, knowledgeable staff. Free wifi for the duration of your stay, breakfast very good, clean and peaceful surroundings. Late-ish checkout at 12noon, they also allow you to leave your bags/suitcases with them if you are flying out later in the evening. The location is excellent, between Rialto bridge and San Marco - if coming by water bus the Rialto stop is easiest and closest - however, make sure you have a good map and get directions. We had to ask inside another hotel where it was. QUick tip - location is 30 yards on from Hotel Canaletto (which is signposted off one of the main squares off Rialto bridge). Room was lovely and felt "venetian" with heavy drapery and "gold" thread etc.. shower/bathroom nice and big, clean and well thought out. Hairdryer

Reviews.Title: “Decor, location, friendly staff, all in all great stay with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: julieGDA
Reviews.Content: Location right by a canal with a walk over a bridge to San Marco (7mins), another walk through a typical Venetian alleyway and you are at the Rialto (7mins). Hotel was excellent felt relaxed straightaway. (A clear map of how to find the hotel would be a bonus).

Reviews.Title: “Great location situated between Rialto and Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated the quality of the Aqua Palace hotel, the breakfast was good plenty of choice and more than adequate. The staff serving breakfast were friendly and helpful. The hotel is decorated beautifully, very stylish and extremely clean. The room 206 was small and situated at the back of the hotel and at first we were a little disappointed by the size and lack of light in the room. We did request a room with a canal view but we were told that they were fully booked which in time realised they weren't, but we had in fairness found a really competitive price for the room so we couldn't complain. We had no problems with noise early in the morning and the bathroom was large. Difficult to find and no-one knew where it was! We found some of the reception staff and I am sorry to say the owners aloof. Our impression was if you weren't spending vast amounts of money you were treated differently which seemed such a shame as the hotel was lovely. DON'T take up the hotels offer of the complimentary boat trip to the Murano glass factory. The gentleman who took us to the boat was a character and the boat trip was enjoyable however on arrival we have never felt so pressured to buy undoubtedly beautiful pieces of art at extremely high prices. Very pushy staff which totally spoilt the experience. We had a wonderful few days and Venice is a really magical place very expensive but we were warned prior to our visit. We would love to return in the future. Beautiful architecture and plenty of culture so many little treasures.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't that easy to locate the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yilin T
Reviews.Content: Overall Aqua Palace is good. Rooms are furnished in the Venetian style. Very good size with a huge bathroom. Breakfast was included and had a good selection of cold cuts and hot food like scrambled eggs and sausages. However, we tried to follow the walking directions but got hopelessly lost and no one we asked knew where it was. I liked that there was free wifi. Could've been better had they provided complimentary drinking water daily and also tea/coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenbeenthere
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Aqua Palace Hotel and what a fantastic hotel it is.....It is as it appears on the website ie looks wonderful and is....great location between Rialto and Piazza San Marco....all staff from bellboy up to manger were kind, attentive, charming and friendly......would I stay there again....most definitely YES......would I recommend it most definitely YES!.....ps make sure you get a canal view room....stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff were fantastic. The concierge offered me hot coffee when I arrive to hotel. The location is perfect, midway between Rialto and St Marks on the Rio de la Guerra. My room was very spacious with beautiful furniture and everything you need. The bed was a little to hard. Breakfast in the morning was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Mcgeouski
Reviews.Content: From opening the front door to exiting , our stay was perfect. Front desk, housekeeping, breakfast .. Amazing, comfortable, top service and a very good rate. We extended as many nights as we could. Great service in a great city!! Grazie Mille!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice weekend in Aqua Palace Venice”
Reviews.Author: happyhallow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a special weekend planned to Venice and after searching we decided to try the Aqua Palace. It was a good choice. It is a small boutique style hotel with about 20 rooms. At arrival they upgraded us for free to a better room. Our room was nicely decorated. A beautiful bathroom. And - important for me - quiet. A good bed; we slept well. We had a view over one of the canals. A really nice view. The staff was helpful. Breakfast was fine, not very special. But for Italian style it was a fine breakfast and the coffee was great. The hotel does not have a restaurant but that is no problem there are so many places to eat in the area. The hotel was not so good in recommending restaurants, but part of the problem is that in January a lot of places are closed. I recommend you do a good restaurant search yourself because it is not so easy to eat well in Venice, you sort of need to know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Superior Experience”
Reviews.Author: CVHotels
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the only word you could use to describe it was simply 'magical'. We stayed in room 104, which had a door which opened onto a juliet balcony overlooking a postcard canal view with bridges. The room including bathroom were pure luxury. Location was perfect, breakfast lovely. A world class hotel that we would have no hesitation in returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1967_Paul
Reviews.Content: Aqua Palace is one of the nicest hotel I have stayed in. Front desk staff very friendly spoke English . Breakfast was a good selection.Stayed in a junior suite with canal views the marble bathroom was great.Would recommend anyone wanting a 4 star hotel.A+

Reviews.Title: “Ok Guys, sell your home and move to the Aqua Palace”
Reviews.Author: Cameron_D1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. I have travelled the world... many countries including Venice 4 times. In Europe, hotels can be very hit and miss. I have stayed at some hotels that are really good, ok and some that you would let you pet stay in. This hotel is outstanding. From the moment you walk in, the decor, the feel, the fact that it is in the middle of the shopping district or the great buffet breakfast (yes - it is great) - you will have an awesome time here. I stayed in a junior suite - quite lovely and very roomy. Great bathroom, bed - oh just lovely and the staff - great. They even turn your bed in when your out late so when you come back to your suite, it is warm, bed turned and the lights set in such a lovely mood. Be quick though... this hotel is fresh on the market and I can tell from the amount of people walking through the door enquiring that it will be a set venue for Venice for a long time. Please - if you come - stay here or you can write a review to say I was wrong..... I am not - trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah T
Reviews.Content: We had a last minute two days in Venice with our teenage sons (who are very savvy and polite), and the Aqua Palace Hotel was absolutely perfect. Beautifully situated, lovely decor, generous rooms, awesome bathroom, genteel living room set up when you get off the elevator, and the staff was also superb. Accommodating, friendly, reliable. We can't wait to stay there again. Can't recommend Christmas at this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: hkemp22
Reviews.Content: Just returned having spent 3 nights at the hotel. The location was fantastic and the standard of our room 201 was outstanding. The service given by all staff couldn't be faulted. The breakfast offered a great choice and set us up for the day and the young lady who served us i think her name was silvia offered the best service we have had on our holidays. BOOK THIS HOTEL you will not be dissapointerd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: EliseSydney_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The rooms are beautiful and spacious with spectacular bathrooms (for europe). The hotel is well located in Venice close to the local attractions and ferry. The price is reasonable for what you get. Everyone on staff took particular pride in delivering the best service (by international standards). Breakfast was great too. My advice re: Venice is to have 80 euro available to spend on a water taxi each way. While the ferry is local to this hotel, Venice is paved and full of bridges making dragging luggage quite an exercise and the ferry is slow. Either this or leave your luggage in lockup at the bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sea_sun_lover54
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. We prefer smaller, boutique type city hotels with personal service, and this is one such hotel. A former palace, the luxury feel has been maintained by fabulous period decor alongside very modern and pristine facilities. The location is perfect, midway between Rialto and St Marks on the Rio de la Guerra. We had a junior suite with a canal view which was superb. The staff on the front desk were very courteous and helpful with booking concerts (don't miss the wonderful Interpreti Veneziani ensemble) etc, and we really enjoyed the complimentary trip to Murano by water taxi to visit a glass-blowing factory. It was an amazing place, and we did not feel pressured to make a purchase. We would recommend extending this trip with a visit to Burano, a truly beautiful little island. Breakfast at the hotel was superb in terms of choice, quality and friendliness of service. I would not stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel on a small canal - excellent”
Reviews.Author: ByrenToronto
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Venice was dampened by the weather (sic) but greatly enhanced by our stay in this wonderful hotel. We had a junior suite and moved to be overlooking the canal (hey when in Venice...). A word of caution however if you chose to be on the canal. The 'garbage scows' (water garbage trucks) park outside in the morning to collect the garbage and the crane on the scow is a bit noisy. This didn't bother us but if you want to sleep in, try another location in the hotel. The staff was excellent - very helpful in all ways. The room was large and well appointed. Absolutely no complaints. The location was ideal. Away from the crowds and noice (exception above) but 4-5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and 7 minutes to the Rialto bridge.and Gran Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Stonecreekmanor
Reviews.Content: Our trip of a lifetime ended in Venice, Italy at the Aqua Palace Hotel. We existed of two couples (yes we are picky) We arrived early in the morning by water taxi, greeted by the hotel staff and were warmly welcomed. Loved everything about this hotel. More than willing to make you so very happy! More like the boutique hotels that Americans are use too. The two couples were given superb rooms on the Canal. Really fun!!! Stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian romance!”
Reviews.Author: Lenore38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days while on holiday celebrating our 30th anniversary. We were greeted in our room with a gorgeous flower arrangement and card with the best wishes of the management- nice touch! The room was soooo Venetian: silk wall coverings, lush draperies, fabulous chaise lounge, gilded writing desk and magnificent marble bathroom! We had a lovely canal view and we weren't at all bothered by morning noise. Everyplace in Venice is hard to find, but we followed the directions on the website from the Rialto vaporetto stop and we had no trouble even though it was our first time in Venice. There's really no need for a water taxi - it's only a 5 minute walk and you have to learn your way around sometime! The location is ideal: just a few minutes walk to San Marco, Rialto and the morning market, which is early but totally worth waking up for! The hotel was great at making dinner reservations and arranging the obligatory gondola ride. Breakfast was quite extensive, hot and cold dishes. The croissants filled with jam were the best and the waitress was among the friendliest people we met. On the day we left, our plane was so early we had to leave before breakfast started at 7, yet when we came downstairs, our cappuccinos were waiting for us, along with an early breakfast. It was so appreciated. Everything about the hotel gushed Venetian charm and elegance, from the Murano chandeliers to the velvet ottoman in the elvator!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find at First but Well Worth it ! Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: breffnicom
Reviews.Content: Delightful Hotel with great staff. Gabriele at the front desk gives a superior welcome and Silvia delivers a super service breakfast !! Lovely views in oversized suite, much better than expected. Right next door is our favorite Venice Restaurant which is a big plus when one has walked all day long. Ae Sconte is the restaurant and Roberto and his sister are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “October 2011”
Reviews.Author: 25thanniversary2011
Reviews.Content: 25TH ANNIVERSARY. Very nice room. upgraded on arrival. Window outside where garbage was emptied on Monday early morning. Very noisy. Breakfast nice staff pleasant. Very cool when we traveled. room comfortable. nice clean room. bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Helpful Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CCGetaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. It's not cheap, but it's on a small side canal so very quiet, not terribly hard to find (relative, in Venice!), and wonderful staff from bellmen to restaurant and front desk. We had a lovely room with plenty of space, and a view to die for. it's like Disneyland come alive outside the windows (we chose a smaller canal-view room over a larger room right on the water, which we thought would be too loud). Somehow the hotel manages to be contemporary and charming at the same time (how DO they do that?), with lovely furnishings and comfortable bed (hard, but comfy!).

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis close to the sites”
Reviews.Author: Travelfromhampshire
Reviews.Content: The Aqua Palace Hotel is a little difficult to find but that is because it is off the main thoroughfares whilst still very close to both St Marks and the Rialto bridge, which is pretty much ideal- but it took us a couple of days to get our bearings and learn the routes back! We thought the staff were all very friendly and helpful especially the waitress at breakfast; the buffet breakfast offered a reasonable choice and was good quality. Our standard room was at the back with no view but we realised that was to be expected- there are other rooms with canal views as an upgrade- and it was nice and quiet and well decorated and furnished. We got a good deal by Venice standards but prices are generally high in the City. We would certainly consider a return stay if we were thinking of a hotel in Venice. From this central location we pretty much walked the whole city in five days and it is easy to get to the water buses which are great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in an enchanting city”
Reviews.Author: Nors93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqua Palace hotel for two nights in mid-October in a twin room. The hotel was not especially easy to find but then nothing is in Venice! Top tip: take a detailed map of the city with you as it is very easy to get lost and find yourself going around in circles! Nevertheless the hotel was in an excellent location at just 4-5 minutes walk from the Rialto bridge and the waterbus terminal. It's also centrally located in relation to the rest of the city so it's not difficult to explore all the adjoining quarters. If you haven't got much time in Venice it's worth taking the Line 1 waterbus which follows the route of the Grand Canal running through Venice. This hotel clean and modern. The reception staff were not overly friendly but certainly polite and courteous. Our room was on the ground floor but we didn't have any problems with noise. In fact, the hotel is rather quiet. The room overlooked the canal and footbridge; one downside is people can look in so you end up keeping the curtain's drawn for privacy and so not much daylight can get through (minor problem when you're spending the majority of the time outside sightseeing). The room was spotless. The bed was very comfortable-we got a good night's sleep on both nights. The hotel provides free wireless internet access in the rooms but you need to ask for a username and password. The room included breakfast which was OK although the pastries were delicious. All in all, we had a wonderful time in Venice and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ont so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: guy d
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite facing the canal. But the canal is a garbage water way so at 7:30 am all you hear is the noise from the pick ups. Hotel is very difficult to find and you will get lost very easily. Also the staff was quiet cold and not very friendly. Sylvia in the breakfast room was the only one who was super friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “AMORE VENICE”
Reviews.Author: deanyboy_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the aqua Palace from 6th Oct -10th Oct in a standard room which was on the fourth floor with no view of the canal, however the room was kept very clean and tidy. I found the reception staff very polite and Sylvia in the breakfast room was so nice and welcoming! she really is a helpful happy woman! The breakfast selection was very good with all you could ask for. Only thing i could moan about was that we got charged 18 euros to iron one shirt and a pair of pants!! I didnt find Venice smelly like people say and also found things in general more reasonable on price than i expected. If you want to indulge and dont mind the budget go to FLORIAN in St.Marks and have a proseco listening to the band, or got to the BAUER Hotel for lunch on the terrace FAB!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: pagh
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way, which can be an oasis after the frenzy of Rialto & San Marco, impeccabable service, from greetings staff at receptions, Gabriele et Co., luggage assistance, breakfast room Silvia, the best "uova strapazzate" are hers. Standard room lacked view, over roof tops but did not expect different, spacious, cleaned and sheets changed daily, evening turned down, bath room great, fab amenities, from AP complimentary slippers & zippered AP bag, Assistance with anything from Reception,concerts, appointment with hair sculptor, beautiful environment, made the three nights fly and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we looked for”
Reviews.Author: GranmaAlma
Reviews.Content: Following reviews, ratings and pictures on tripadvisor we selected this hotel and reserved a suite for 3 nights end of September. The hotel was just what we wanted a smaller boutique hotel with an excellent location and good service. The junior suite was very spacious and comfortable with a view on a narrow canal. The breakfast was delicious . The staff was VERY forthcoming. Although when the water is low the canal smells a bit, we did not feel it in the room nor in any other part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: aafendy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 week vacation in Italy to celebrate our 2 year anniversary, and Venice was our first stop. I booked this hotel from the trip advisor ratings, pictures, and reviews. I was looking for a boutique and modern hotel and this hotel was just that. We stayed at the Aqua Palace for 2 nights and everything was just great. It took us a little while to find the hotel because of the alleys but once you know your way around, its very easy. The hotel is in a excellent location and very close to everything. I mentioned to the hotel that it was a our 2nd year annivesary and if they can give us a good room, and they did just that. The room was very spacious and clean and when you open up the windows your view is of the grand canal. The breakfast was great, it had some hot selections and a assortment of cheeses,bread,jams and spreads and anything else you want. The staff was great and friendly. The only thing that I would mention that I did not find great about the hotel is that when you check in they give you a list of services and tours they can book for you and one is a tour of the islands. They say it is free and you will have a taxi pick you up and take you there. We left around 11 am and the water taxi picked us up, and that was great because we could see more of venice from a boat, but when they drop you off at a glass factory they make you take a tour of the factory and they show you demonstrations of how to blow glass. That was great, but then afterwards I felt that they were very pushy and pressuring you to buy pieces (which were quite pricey!). And then when you were finished, instead of going on a private water taxi they send you back on the public transport. But other than that, everything was excellent and Aqua Palace made our stay in Venice memorable and I hope to return soon one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location Lovely rooms but some glitches”
Reviews.Author: MilanoSwimmer
Reviews.Content: I went for 3 days in Venice for a conference and stayed at Aqua Palace hotel in a junior suite with my wife. The hotel location is great at walking distance from Rialto and San Marco with direct access to a canal for motor boat and gondolas. The room was lovely with absolutely no bad smell in typical venitian style large enough with a magnificient view on a narrow canal and a large bathroom with a more than confortable shower . The morning breakfast was delicious a mix of english breakfast and italian espresso / cappuccino /brioche breakfast. Service was very friendly and professional. But some glitches do not allow me to give maximum rating: Entering in the lobby we where shocked by a very bad smell that persisted for the whole period of our stay The breakfast menu lacked freshly squeezed orange juice which i consider a plus. The staff is nice but not really focused on customer needs. In the morning of the first day I found out that i forgot my shaving kit and i was not very pleased to go to my morning meeting without shaving. I asked to the hotel staff but after some time they said that they could not find. So I had to go to the meeting without shaving. In the evening I had another meeting and i asked again but the answer was : we have ordeed it but still not delivered . Therefore I had to rush out and find (not easy in venice) a supermarket to buy a shaving kit. In conclusion a lovely hotel that could be perfect with more attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer016
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from four nights at the Aqua Palace Hotel. I booked it having read previous reviews on Trip Advisor and was delighted by the choice. Its location is perfect, being about 3 minutes stroll from Piazza San Marco but just far enough away to avoid the madding crowds. It is a little oasis of air conditioned calm; the sort of place you can go back to for a quick cool down before heading off to yet another museum or church. It has its own canal entrance that made arrival and departure by boat easy. Our ground floor room, overlooking a canal, was decorated in a sumptuous Venetian style and kept spotlessly clean. The marble tiled bathroom was large and well appointed. Other reviewers have commented on the excellence of the staff and they are spot on. The reception team were exceptionally helpful and provided three superb recommendations for local restaurants where we had some memorable dinners. They also booked the restaurants for us. The breakfast buffet had hot and cold options and was more than adequate. It was overseen by another friendly and chatty member of staff. I would really struggle to find anything of consequence to criticise. We will, no doubt, return to Venice and the Aqua Palace will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the four stars”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo2011_11
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand all ravings about this hotel. I usually stay in a 5-star hotel, but when I was in Venice, the Film Festival was going on and all hotels were sold out, so I chose Aqua Palace after reading all good reviews here. A big mistake. The hotel is "nice" only in the sense that the hotel staff would smile at you whenever they see you That is all. Our "junior suite" is in reality a shabby double, with a flat tv on the right hand side of the bed (which was by the way very small), so in order to watch it, you would need to tilt your neck and spine. The room had not been cleaned when we got back at 1 pm--and no apology. The front desk did not offer things we needed--no stamps, no water bus tickets. The breakfast is rather poor--juices from cartons, a very few selections of cold cuts, etc. etc. If you are used to a first-rate hotel with professional services, do not try here.

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite, well-managed modern boutique hotel in a quiet area near Rialto and San Marco.”
Reviews.Author: Divedivapro
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a night prior to our Greek Island cruise, and the night we returned. It was not our first choice but I waited too long to book and due to the Venice Film Festival, many of the good hotels were fully booked. I am glad now that we were fortunate enough to have chosen this beautiful small hotel (25 rooms), on a small canal within a ten minute walk of either Rialto Bridge or San Marco square. The hotel is about a year old and very modern. It is beautifully and tastefully decorated in tones of gold and navy blue, very elegant (fabric walls), but not overdone. Spotless and well-maintained. The junior suite is worth paying extra, and we had a beautiful canal view from 203(first night), and 404 (second night after returning from the cruise). The room is very large by European standards, and the bathroom was beautifully done in marble. There is a safe in the room, and a mini-bar. There is free WiFi. The hotel was full, but we never heard another guest. The service was efficient, but unobtrusive, and Gabrielle, the reservations manager, kept track of my endless emails about ground transportation to and from the hotel and airport and cruise ship organized, and never failed to reply politely. When I left my purse on the water taxi from the airport (talk about panic...), he tracked down the driver, and walked us to a meeting point some 10 minutes away to retrieve the purse. The breakfast is very nice, with fresh fruits, breads, pastries, cereals, breakfast meats, cheeses, and I believe some chafing dishes with eggs and bacon. The tables were tended to by Sylvia, who was always quick to inquire about our visit, and keep the coffee coming. There is a highly-rated Trip Advisor restraurant just steps away from the hotel "Osteria Ae Sconte." We were fortunate to get a table at 7 on a Saturday evening, and the meal and service were fantastic, and the prices reasonable. If you are looking for an elegant, spotless, well-managed hotel in a quiet area close to the tourist attractions, I highly recommend the Aqua Palace. It is a bit more expensive than other hotels, but well worth it. We would not hesitate to return when we again visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Kristen C
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel just steps from Rialto and San Marco. Spent three nights in a luxuriously updated room with huge bathroom. Would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Venice. Friendly, helpful service, good breakfast, great restaurant recommendations, chic rooms, a perfect stay. No complaints at all. Hotel booked concert tickets and a private boat taxi tour for us that picked us up from the hotel dock. The latter was super romantic and one of the best things we did in our entire trip to Italy. The hotel is a bit hard to find, so I would recommend not arriving in Venice too late in the day. After getting off the vaporretto at Rialto, the hotel is a 5-10 minute walk away, but it's hidden. It took about 30 minutes of wandering with a map before we stumbled upon it. We asked for directions at other hotels, but no one had even heard of the address. In order to get to Acqua Palace, you have to wander down some tiny alleys that you can't imagine could possibly take you to the hotel, so arriving before dark would be best. After all the wandering, the hotel is definitely worth it, and it's nice to be a bit out of the way fom the major tourist thoroughfares. One more note, if arrivin by train, make sure your train goes all the way to Santa Lucia Station, especially if you arrive late. We made the mistake of getting a ticket only as far as Mestre, thinking that there would be frequent trains to Santa Lucia. But, late at night the train was running only once an hour, and the Mestre Station is NOT a place you want to hang out for a long time at night.

Reviews.Title: “The Aqua Palace is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hilmel
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our choice of The Aqua Palace in Venice. This was our first trip to Venice, 2 adults and children 20, 17 and 14. We would not consider staying anywhere else! The decor is a stylish mix of contemporary with a traditional venetian feel. We had 2 enormous canal view rooms on the second floor, beautifully decorated and clean, with sumptious large luxurious bathrooms. There is a lovely lobby area outside the rooms which is great to have a quiet moment in.Fast wifi is another bonus. We got the hotel to organise a taxi from the railway station and it was wonderful to be greeted with a smiling face and to arrive at the hotel in a breathtaking manner. Yes it's expensive way to travel, but the experience is worth it. The breakfasts are buffet style, and the best hotel breakfasts we enjoyed in Europe. The position is terrific, close to everything, and easy to find your way back to if you get lost wandering around Venice! We often grabbed a huge pizza slice from the hole in the wall piazzera outside the hotel, an easy and inexpensive way to feed 3 teenagers! The hotel also organised us a gondola ride, and a free morning trip to Murano, both great fun experiences.The resturaunts the Aqua Palace recommended were excellent, particularly the one 50m from their door, the only night we were disappointed was the night we chose our own eatery! Make sure you make the time to enjoy a Bellini on the hotel's water dock, a fantastic place to absorb and experience Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Modern, Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Hotlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Aqua Palace in early Aug 2011 and had a wonderful stay. The hotel had been renovated within the past year, and it is fairly modern in decor and everything is new and in good condition. The bed was fantastic. (It Italy we find them too hard and often with the split in the middle.) The room we had was fairly small (but perhaps average for Italy), but the bathroom was quite large with a tub and plenty of counter space. The room had a safe and the AC was very good. (Several of the other hotels we stayed at during this trip had weak AC's and never quite cooled the rooms). The hotel is in a great spot, between St. Marks Square and the Rialto, but enough off the beaten path so it is quiet. The staff were very helpful, and they got us a reservation at the top restaurant (per Rick Steves) where they knew the owner. Breakfast was more than the traditional pastries and coffee and included eggs and bacon and had the most pleasant staff. Overall a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Melb0urne_Melb0urne
Reviews.Content: Aqua Palace Hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. The room was large and luxurious, with a huge marble bathroom and windows opening over the canal. It seemed to be very recently renovated. The free Wifi was fast, the included breakfast was generous and the hotel's charges were exactly as advertised when we booked: no added "room tax" or other random additions. A daily copy of the International Herald Tribune was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: PatricSA
Reviews.Content: This is a very stunning hotel, in a quiet street, but close to restaurants and attractions. It was extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine9888
Reviews.Content: Great Modern Hotel- Awesome location- a little hard to find but I would highly recommend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful rooms, friendly staff, perfect breakfast. Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AndMarBoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes walk from st Marks square which is perfect. St Marks square is so noisy and packed with tourists that you don't want to be staying too close to it. Free wi-fi was provided which was great. All staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast although was not extensive the range was perfect. Good view from the room, which also had a large bathroom. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafiregirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a Great location, it was very clean, and for being close to everything it was very quiet

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ZC12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Palace Hotel. The staff were friendly, professional and helpful without being pushy. A quiet sophistication surrounds the place. The rooms are very nicely decorated in traditional Venetian style and the entrance and landings have seating areas where you can sit and enjoy a drink or watch the activities on the canal outside from the balcony. Breakfast is served in a pleasant dining room and there is plenty of choice. The restaurant recommendation was excellent. It was a haven of calm from which to enjoy all the vibrant sights and life of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel in a fabulous location!!”
Reviews.Author: psulovers
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just stayed here when we were visiting venice, on our 1 yr anniversary. this was the first hotel (in 4 throughout italy) that felt really service-oriented from the start. when we arrived, the manager showed us 2 rooms so we could have our choice of a floor level room or 4th floor. we selected the 4th floor, a room with nice natural light from a skylight, although no view of the canal. but that was fine with us because the second you step out of the hotel you are right there on the water! the location was awesome, as we were able to stop here numerous times as we walked around town. it is 5 min from the rialto, and 5 min from st. mark's. the breakfast in the morning was really nice as well, with very friendly staff ready to make you an extra strong cappucino, the way i like it! the front desk gave us a great recommendation to go for lunch, right around the corner. we also scheduled a water taxi with them the morning of our flight to head to the airport. although it's pricey, it was well worth the price for the ease of picking you up at your door and arriving to venice airport in 25 minutes! would absolutely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant escape from the tourist madness of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JLR22
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the character of Venice, but being fairly newely refurbished, everything was also clean and sleek and working properly. The room we had was small and int he back, top corner of the hotel, but it still lived up to the website and had a well sized and appointed bathroom (finally, a hotel with a 2000w hairdryer! thank you Aqua Palace!!). We arrived by water taxi (expensive but worth every cent) and were greeted at the canal door by a warm and friendly attendant. We arrived 2 and half hours before checkin time, and this was no problem for the lovely front desk staff, who were friendly every time we entered or exited the hotel. They happily found the name and address of a restaurant I had heard about and made a booking, and the breakfast waitress, Sylvia, was divine. She made coming down to breakfast a highlight of our days and made a point to come and say goodbye on our last day and wish us a very good time on the rest of our trip. She really was absolutely gorgeous. The bed was comfortable, the wifi (free) worked everywhere and with strong reception, the aircon was equally powerful and the sitting areas on each floor were lovely. The location was excellent for a first trip to Venice - right between rialto and piazza san marco. I have nothing negative to say about our whole stay, so will absolutely recommend them to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: light12
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice for the begining of the Biennale. When entring Venice we encounterd a trafic jam the likes of which we have never seen. We called the hotel and spoke with Gabriel (sorry if I am misspelling) and in 5 minutes a man appearred at our car , he introduced himself and drove us to a parking place . That kind of service is remarkable and we enjoyed it every day staying at the hotel. A warm personal touch by all the staff. The hotel itself is situated between the Realto bridge and and St Mark's square on a small canal , upon our arrivel we were upgraded to a suite with a view of the canal And what a view we had . The rooms are large and well appointed and the beds are very nice. The hotel has a private peer and we enjoyed sitting in the evening drinking wine and watching the gondolas go by. Breakfast was very nice and the attention given to us by the lady in charge of the breakfast area was nothing but exceptional. We feel the Aqua Palace is a superb hotel and even more so because of the staff. We plan to return for the ballo e maschera.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Womble1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqua Palce for 4 nights and enjoyed a very pleasant stay. Friendly service from the front desk, nicely appointed room, beautifully decorated and a very large bathroom. The hotel had a delicious boutique feel. You can arrive at the hotel by boat taxi which can drop you at the door, and I would recommend this option, at it would be difficult to locate intially if you were arriving at St Mark's square or the Rialto bridge. It is conveniently located just a short stroll from St Marks and Rialto, so perfectly positioned, with several pleasant restaurants close by. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: super_summilux
Reviews.Content: At first I was not sure about this hotel since the web reviews were limited - fortunately it turned out to be a pleasant place to stay. This hotel is easily accessible from Vaporetto (public water bus) piers S.Marco or S.Zaccaria, but since Venice has lots of tiny backstreets and bridges, some find it worths the extra cost to hire a Motoscafi (water taxi) directly from the airport to the hotel (the hotel has its own boat pier) than dragging heavy luggage up and down all the way from Piazza S.Marco - especially when you're traveling with your family with kids. The rooms are small, in our case with no view (view and sunlight blocked by another hotel next door) - but that's standard among hotels in Venice and I was aware of that and not complaining because the room was always clean. If you need a spacious room with a sun deck and a beautiful guest accessible garden, I recommend the 4 stars hotels in Certosa or Giudecca islands. I loved this hotel because of the availability (easier to book because its not that popularly known), excellent location, and the great breakfast. The breakfast is prepared at the restaurant area on the first floor, buffet style with selections of more than 5 kinds each of bacon & cheese, fresh fruit & yoghurt, tasty croissant and sweet danish pastries (different kind everyday), and Americano coffee served in larger cups. Yes, the espresso is delicious there, but I loved that they served that larger portion of fresh brewed black coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Sara34678
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean hotel w/friendly staff and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Palace in best location”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: We decided for Aqua Palace because of the combination of price (â‚¬ 161,00/night via Trivago), Tripadvisor rating and location. At e 161.00/night in July, including breakfast & Wi-Fi internet there's nothing to complain about. It's a solid 4 star hotel. Of course our room was small (as expected because I've booked the cheapest one) but when in Venice anyway nobody will stay in the room for long. The room was well equipped, the bathroom (marble) very cosy. Staff, especially reception is super-friendly but not fake-friendly. Best is the location, right in the middle of Rialto Bridge & S. Marco square. If you do have a map you'll find the hotel any time. Why 4 points and not 5? When I would have paid full price I would expect a slightly bigger room, not just one pillow/person and a better blanket. Would I stay at Aqua Palace again? At the rate I got: YES!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique style hotel, an oasis of calm away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: jdp123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aqua Palace for our 10th wedding anniversary and we couldn't have made a better choice. The staff were friendly and very helpful, always willing to give you their time to recommend places to go or restaurants to visit. The breakfast was great, a good choice of fresh fruit, cereals and pastries (a hot selection was also available)and the coffee was excellent. The location of the hotel was great, away from the main tourist areas and about half way between the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco, though we would definately recommend getting the water taxi as finding it on foot for the first time would be a challenge!

Reviews.Title: “10 on a scale of 1-5 not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: FuninNormandy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a glorious trip to this hotel with my husband. I have travelled extensively and especially to Venice and was particularly impressed with this hotel from A-Z A simple search on the internet brought me to this little gem. A boutique hotel all newly furnished refined Venetian touches especially the fabrics, flowers and little details such as the cushioned seat in the elevator We stayed in room 304 (probably one of the more expensive rooms) but well worth it. A large comfy bed, two windows overlooking the canal, a beautiful bathroom all in marble. The service was excellent and the quality of everything here' top'. Lots of closet space, bathrobes and nice toiletries. An oversize shower to die for! I especially enjoyed having a Bellini (Venitian local drink) on the picture perfect terrase for two overlooking the bridge and the canal. The front desk service was excellent; they lent me a laptop in order for me to keep up with our reservations at our hotel and breakfast was very nice with a lovely serveuse and a great buffet selection with wonderful fresh fruit and very good coffee We did not have any difficulty at all finding this location (conveniently located between the Rialto and San Marco Place thanks to the good directions. It is a wonderful boutique hotel and not to be missed a final note If you are looking for a large palace and or an onsite fab restaurant or bar this may not be the place for you. They do serve drinks and the restaurant is there but its much more fun going out and exploring the many fine restaurants by foot that the front desk can help you with. A very warm thanks to Piero and Giorgio whom made our stay extra special Grazie mille :) l americaine de Honfleur

Reviews.Title: “"A Prosecco would be lovely"?”
Reviews.Author: Tourists016
Reviews.Content: What better way to end off a day touring the many side roads and bridges (time and time again as you continually get lost) than a great hotel with excellent views and facilities. I had a junior suite room so plenty of daylight and canal views unlike many dark roomed hotels I've stopped in before. I've been to Venice a few times but this time was really special, from the moment I arrived on the speedboat-best way ever to first see Venice- and was dropped at the hotel steps, I knew all was going to be a joy.With smiling staff always ready to be helpful and many great recommendations to restaurants this was a very relaxing trip, missing everything, the sun, the beauty and those Bellini!

Reviews.Title: “expected slightly more for my money”
Reviews.Author: jazzzabell
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Airmiles and had read a lot of reviews about it online. I was under the impression that this was the kind of hotel that would make a lot of effort to make your stay perfect. So i emailed to request a room with a view of the canal and received a reply stating that to do this i would have to pay a supplement of 50 euros per night. Airmiles called the room a Junior Suite as i was expecting a lot more as i was paying Â£100 per night. The Hotel also didn't have a bar which i found disappointing. It was also really hard to find and we spent about Â£40 on i phone internet charges trying to locate it. All in all i bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to this excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NTJKelly
Reviews.Content: This year we paid our second visit to the Aqua Palace. From the moment we arrived, with a warm welcome from all, to the moment we left, the service at the Aqua Palace is unsurpassed. We look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: shilps2000
Reviews.Content: Aqua Palace was a great choice for our short 2 night stay in Venice. They upgraded us up to a room overlooking the adjacent canal which was lovely (and kind of expected after reading a lot of the reviews here). Beautiful, tastefully decorated room. WONDERFUL breakfast spread with the most delicious croissants and kind staff. Free wi-fi. A bit tricky to find, unless youâ€™re really good with a map and directions (both of which they provide on their website). Great location, very close to Piazza San Marco and not far from the Rialto either. Canâ€™t really say anything negative, it was a splurge for us, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: karen6468
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely suite, 2 room connected by a hall and bathroom. I was with my daughter and her husband and we were very confortable in the suite. It was very large, clean, great products and very well appointed. The owner was extremely friendly and was very helpful. He gave us great restaurants to go to. The location is great. Breakfast was extremely good, basically anything you wanted and all fresh. The help was very friendly and we felt like we were very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: Colton_Gartin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and in a very central location. Accomodations are first rate. Initially locating the hotel once in Venice can be a bit of a challenge but not impossible. Once you find it, you will appreciate the location. Only complaint comes as a gay traveler. Venice isn't the most common gay destination and has limited gay bars and restaurants. Unfortunately, the hotel's web portal filters any search terms including "gay" and categorizes that term as pornography. This limits a guest's ability to search for a local establishment. Regardless, this is a wonderful hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTrvlbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aqua Palace for 3 nights at beginning of May, first trip to Venice. Glad we accepted the hotels offer to arrange water taxi direct to hotel, even though expensive, not sure how we would have found hotel otherwise, and would not have wanted to carry our bags over the bridges. Once we got our bearings we realized just how central the hotel was to Rialto and San Marco. Breakfast was good, view from room (Junior suite) was a bit disappointing, view of wall and had to lean out window to see canal, but otherwise was very clean and comfortable. Local restaurant was very good, just around corner from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a very good location”
Reviews.Author: An_and_Fe
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 2 nights and everything was perfect... The junior suite is really nice and the location is strategical - between Rialto and San Marco Square!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Quaint, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: stinkey2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in here in Venice for 2 nights. The rooms and service were great. They arranged transportation from the airport to our hotel (we travelled from US and arrived severely jet-legged. The hotel is in a fabulous location in the midst of everything, yet is somehow very quaint and on a small canal away from the thick crowds. I'd recomment this to the most picky of friends and family (and I'm high maintenance). We would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunsetduo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Palace for two nights in April and had a wonderful stay. Great location, very clean rooms and public spaces, staff was so attentive, breakfast was great. We travel a lot and we will most definitely stay here again and will recommend it to our friends and family. Would also recommend room #304 with views to the canal and great natural light from two windows.....very special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic hotel !!! top Location, and efficient friendly staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Attorney
Reviews.Content: We went to the aqua Palace for valentine with my wife, and everything was just perfect from arrival to departure. The rooms are confortale and is is very central. The front desk staff were very helpfull and advised some very good restaurants( which is not always the case in such touristic destinations). The lady serving the breakfast is very welcoming and friendly, always smiling. You really feel home. Will definitely be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Mark1971_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aqua Palace as part of a flight/hotel package for 3 nights, attracted by the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is fantastic, the location perfect for getting around the city and situated off a quiet street with direct canal access via a private side entrance. The room we used was 206, and it was an ideal size with AC, flat screen TV, WiFi free, a safe etc etc. The decoration was very modern with a Venetian style, but not too ostentatious. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom area, and was finished to an exceptional standard, overall the room did not leave us wanting in any way. As for the staff, they were so helpful and friendly, even before we arrived via e-mail we arranged water taxis, a bottle of wine etc all at a reasonable cost and could not fault the service offered. Breakfast was plentiful and in a very pleasant intimate dining area, and again quality and service was first class. There were plenty of places to eat nearby, all of a good standard for both a light lunch and dinner and not too expensive. I would highly recommend The Aqua Palace to anyone, it is the best kept secret in Venice when it comes down to stylish and quality hotels. Thank you to Receptionist Gabrielle and Manager Piergiovanni who arranged all our transport and requirements prior to arrival, and to the rest of the staff who made our stay terrific...We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful rooms, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJeny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location: close to all attractions, yet off the main path. It is right on a canal for easy pick up/drop off and has amazing canals views. The staff was extremely helpful with city advice and recommending/organizing activities. The rooms were updated and beautiful. I miss it already and would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new and well allocated”
Reviews.Author: Alfredtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this very new, well allocated and small hotel (ony 25 rooms) at a real refurnisehd old Palace. All the staff was very professional, supportive and kind. Nice size rooms, quite hotel. Everything working properly. The only concern was that although very good isolated fron the inside noise it was a little bit not well isolated from the outside (mainly due to narrow streets and channels that amplifly the noise). Price a little bit expensive in comparison to hotels of similar level in other european cities. I recomend the experience

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, wonderful staff and beautiful modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Johncahilton
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Aqua Palace Hotel. The staff were very nice, always welcoming and made our stay that extra bit special. The rooms are gorgeous, very modern as well. Shower design is a little strange (no door), but not a problem. Totally clean and refreshed each day. Breakfast was good with a range of cereals, loads of fruit, bread, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cold meats and yoghurts. A great selection and fantastic service. You don't get many breakfasts like this in venice. Location was fine once you know your way around. It's about 5 mins from Rialto, but do take a map on your first visit. I proposed to my girlfriend on a gondola and the hotel provided a complimentary bottle of champagne (without my request) for our ride around the canals. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL, LOVELY STAFF, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: My sweetie and I spent six nights here, and I think it's a lovely, sophisticated hotel. The staff was wonderful - the front desk gentlemen slightly reserved unless you had a question, and then they were delighted to assist you. The breakfast was wonderful, and Silvia, the ever-friendly breakfast lady, a gem. The room & bathroom (marble) were spacious - we had a room with a canal view, and were very glad we had upgraded. I had a map on which I had marked the hotel, and we had minimal trouble finding it after coming in on Alilaguna (Rialto Bridge).

Reviews.Title: “excellent modern place in the center of venice”
Reviews.Author: olivblau
Reviews.Content: the location is nice, if you want to afford it come by watertaxi (70 euro from piazzale Roma). The design of the hotel is very stringent, cool, Venice style. Staff is extremely friendly (ask Silvia at breaktfast how many languages she knows). Junior Suite have a view to the canal, breakfast is american, quite ok for Italian standards. bath is super elegant. prices are Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MirabellaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Aqua Palace was very difficult to find - if you are not careful you will pass it and not even notice the door way. We even asked merchants and they said they never heard of the hotel. Once finding it, we discovered a rude staff. The porter was very nice, but the two men that were in charge were unfriendly. Our room was very elegantly decorated; had air-conditioning; very nice breakfast; nice amenties; comfortable bedding. The staff was not what we expected from such a beautiful (and very pricey) place.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: wisewo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqua Palace Hotel at the beginning of April and were upgraded when we arrived. It was a nice surprise. The hotel is in a great location and the front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. Our room was very nice and modern. We stayed on the top floor and had our windows open and found it a bit noisy at night. We could have easily closed our windows but it was such beautiful weather that we wanted to enjoy the fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in central Venice”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Elegant new hotel in a great location between Rialto and St. Marks. Well appointed rooms (103, junior suite on the first floor, could be noisy: there's a restaurant just in front), excellent service, good breakfast, free wi-fi, convenient weekend rate at 250 euros/night (which is not bad for venetian standards). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away,just of the main tourist places!”
Reviews.Author: HappyEmm
Reviews.Content: Although other people have said they found it hard to find we found it really easy! Its tucked away between st.Marks square and the Rialto bridge, being easy to find from both ways( as long as you have a map, and my tip is to mark where the hotel is on the map before you go). We went out late to the bacaro jazz bar ( not far from the rialto) and had a fab time, and walked around in the dark after and thought it was great and v.safe. The room was quite small bt lovely and we loved our balcony. Unfortuanly we didnt sleep well as we had lots of noise coming from 1 room!haha, The staff were v.friendly and the location was great,just would have liked a decent sleep!

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: desertguide
Reviews.Content: All was the best, Good location, closed to all importaned sits, New modern Hotel, Exelant brekfest, always with smile

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: holidaychum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away between St Mark's & Rialto, within easy reach of everything, although initially a little tricky to find. Shops, supermarket, cafes are close by. The alilaguna/vaparettos are a 5 minute walk (providing you don't get lost!) A water taxi can drop you outside the hotel. The staff were superb, attentative at all times. The room was spotlessly clean. The safe was a bonus/easy to operate. The marble bathroom was a great size; walk in shower, dbl sinks. Towels/linen changed daily; turn down service-a really disctreet service-like magic they attend the rooms without disturbing the guests (you never see them!) We had no problems with noise from other rooms, which is often an irritation in some hotels. The breakfast was delightful (scrambled egg/bacon, croissants, cereals, fruits, cold meats, tasty cake! juice and capuccino/tea). There is room service at reasonable costs. Trips can be arranged by the receptionists, they will also sort out wifi for you (phone&pc) The only negative was the early start by the builders nearby, but this did not hinder my enjoyment of my trip. A good quality hotel in a peaceful area of Venice, with a little canal outside the window. I am glad I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “A sumptuous Venetian palace”
Reviews.Author: YoungDegsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Aqua Palace for the final days of Venice Carnival, since Martedi Grasso was also my wife's birthday. Firstly, it is an ideal location. 5 mins walk from both the Rialto and St Mark's Square, yet sufficiently off the beaten path to be in a quiet, typically genuine Venetian setting. No doubt it felt better since we had the canal view room on the ground floor (room 92), next to the water door. This is worth swinging if you can: you can watch the world go by on the canals, and there is a (small) gondola departure point outside the front door. The rooms are sumptuously decorated in an 18th century style and the bathrooms positively palatial. We were left some complimentary biscotti - a nice touch, even though we didn't need them. And this really was the hotel's best feature - the service. Nothing was too much trouble. Advice on where to go and what to do, and when, assistance with bags, late arrivals, even tolerance of dodgy Italian phraseology. The manager was always pleasant, cheerful and helpful. The breakfast was a combination of continental with some cooked food, which was quite good; but once again the key feature was the service - friendly, attentive, excellent. Not terribly cheap, but not at all bad given its 4-star rating and location. I wouldn't think of looking anywhere else first when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: fani85
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Piazza San Marco and Rialto,in a perfect location!!! The breakfast was excellent!!! The hotel staff was very helpful. It has also rooms with canal view.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!, the best i've been”
Reviews.Author: Ita_p
Reviews.Content: Me and my new fiancÃ©e spend 4 amazing nights in this luxury hotel. THIS IS A MUST HOTEL and I simply can summarize it as the best I've ever been. I would like to stress one issue above all- the people of this place. From the amazing (!!!) manager of the hotel to the wonderful lady who prepare the great breakfast to the last employee- they all helped us a lot and made it look like a dream. Even though we spent our days in Venice during the crowded week of the carnival they all showed such a good care and they suggested us with places to see and eat and assisted us, simply, with anything. We felt like a king and queen because of their warm and kind hospitality. I could easily write a full page about the crew in general and the manager in specific but the point is clear. Furthermore, the hotel decoration is really beautiful with the most romantic atmosphere you can ask. It's very clean and comfortable and in a prime location between the Rialto and Piazza San Marco. I will never forget this place and this manager and his hotel and we will come back to this palace for sure!!!! And I urge everyone to visit there

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Venice - immaculate & beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyE2549
Reviews.Content: Last minute 3 night stay in Venice and I needed to book 2 rooms for 5 adults. I didn't have time to do much research as it was very last minute..... my hotel priorities were location (close to Rialto Bridge, St Marks Square), somewhere clean & cute, and available guest rooms with views of a canal. I chose the Aqua Palace based on the impressive past reviews and it was a great choice! After reading it was tucked back and somewhat hard to find, we had a private water taxi from the airport so we wouldn't have 5 adults with luggage wondering the small streets looking for it.... the water taxi was an adventure in itself and worth the money. The hotel lobby, guest rooms, & sitting areas were all immaculate and tastefully decorated. We had 2 junior suites and each room and the bathrooms were very large, spacious, comfortable, and spotless. Also, the internet worked perfect (which didn't always happen in other hotels we stayed at in Europe). The front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant and we loved the lady serving breakfast - so nice and friendly to talk to. Would absolutely recommend to others and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: NikosRunner
Reviews.Content: super hotel. the location is great. The rooms big enough and very cosy. The breakfast buffet was small but everything was delicious. Great overall experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBradleyR
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that exceeded my expectations. In a perfect location between Rialto bridge and Piazza San marco - just close enough to both for a very short walk to either but far enough to be relatively quiet. Although Venice seems compact you can find yourself walking a far distance from some locations, so this hotel really was great for me. Larger room than I expected in typical decor. Right on the water with nice views from our window.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: London1969
Reviews.Content: Once we found the Aqua Palace Hotel (always a challenge in Venice) we were met at reception by the manager. We were offered an upgrade to a suite as the hotel was not to busy. This was a very good start to a great 3 night stay. We were taken up to the room by the very welcoming wife of the manager who explained the hotel was owned by her family. The room was beautifully decorated, the bed comfortable and the bathroom a good size. The three windows in the bedroom gave beautiful views of the canal and bridges that the hotel sits by.
