After a great nights sleep the buffet style breakfast was tasty with plenty of choice. Breakfast is served until 10am, which allows you to have a bit of a lie in! On our day of check out we asked if we could keep the room for an extra hour before we left for the airport, this was no problem. Overall the hotel was an excellent choice and we would thoroughly recommend a stay to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: J0ey3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Venice for the weekend at the end of January 2011 and after months of looking on the internet for a good hotel at a reasonable cost we found this one. It's in the perfect location - a few minutes walk from S Marco and a few minutes walk from Rialto bridge. The rooms were really lovely - beautifully decorated, incredible bathrooms and our room had 2 windows looking out over little canals. The breakfast was also included and really tasty. It said continental but there were also eggs, bacon and sausages. Finally the staff were helpful and friendly. I couldn't have found a better hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: nanar37
Reviews.Content: We spent a long week-end at the Aqua Palace in September 2010. The hotel is located in a perfect location, just halfway between Rialto and San Marco. We had chosen a suite with canal view, on the first floor. Looking back, it would have been better on a higher floor. Nevertheless, the room was excellent, nicely decorated, though the ceiling might feel a bit high. One great thing is that you can get a water taxi from the airport right to the entrance off the hotel. The hotel was very helpful in helping us to find the good restaurants nearby, with a special note for Ae Sconte, just 1mn wlaking from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Venice.. bravo bravo bravo.”
Reviews.Author: gmbinca
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom and family friends stayed here a few days. We travel ALOT and this is by far one of the best hotels i've stayed in. The staff will not look at you or pass by with out a friendly "hello" or "may i help you." They are VERY helpful if you have any questions, overall outstanding service in my opinion. The rooms are very spacious and absolutely gorgeous and comfortable. You feel very safe and secure there. The location could not be more perfect either. You can go every direction and find something cool. To the Rialto Bridge or to San Marco Plaza or where ever. Lots of restaurants a short walk. I will definitely stay here again. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “more than excellent”
Reviews.Author: savvas189449
Reviews.Content: we went to aquapalace hotel for 3 days.we found it very easilly while we stopped to rialto.then is 4 minutes walk to the hotel.4 minutes is also to st marks square so is the ideal location to explore venice.as we arrived the owner upgraded our room to a junior suite,that was the best surprise as we went in venice with my fiancee for wedding proposal.the room was excellent.big with very elegant design we felt like kings.i have been in many juniors suites in five stars hotels but this was much better.then the owner made as a reservation in met restaurant.it was excellent good and they gave us a very nice table as we were coming from aquapalace.the breakfast was another suprised for us.the very welcome lady responsible for the breakfast was so welcome and kind she made us feel like family.she is preparing everyday there all the breakfast and everything is fresh and smells wonderfull.we reaaly missed her allready)).then the we organised a gondola trip by the hotel.that was also a suprided.the gondola took us inside the hotel door .a gondola only for us two. i made also the wedding proposal the gondola man sing us in all the trip everything was so beuatifull.and then in then night they made us a reservation in a very good restaurant called vecia cavana.it was perfect,the food and the fishes we ate they were fresh and delicious.all i can say is that we always will looking forward to come to venice and stay in this hotel.we send many thanks to the owner, to the woman in the breakfast and the gondola man for all the moments we had and i say to everyone if u wish to travel to venice there is no other hotel to stay,only one name aquapalace

Reviews.Title: “Good 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roy-aimee
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a few 5* hotels we'd consider the Aqua Palace to be a good 4* hotel. Our room didn't have a view onto an of the internal waterways, just a small courtyard but the hotel is well situated enough and our time in the room was limited as we were out discovering what Venice has to offer! The decor of our room and the hotel was top class. The breakfast was a let down, very limited choice and in our opinion one waitress struggling to cope!! Beware of using RyanAir as your means of transport. Due to adverse weather conditons (fog), we had to endure a 300km coach journey to Bergamo Airport at which time we were moved around like cattle without any RyanAir staff there to answer or advise. A 10:25pm flight ended in arriving in Stansted at 9am the next day due to lazy, incompetant staff with company attitude which is a major cause for conern!! However, don't let this put you off Aqua Palace!! Aqua Palace is a very nice 4* hotel with very few negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: tulip27
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at the aqua palace for our honeymoon in october. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke many languages. We were shown to our room and were very impressed. It was spotlessly clean, had lovely decor and the bed was very comfortable and big. The bathroom was spacious and marble. We were given complementary champagne, crisps and grapes. A slight word of warning though...Don't open the windows!!! We missed the signs on the windows about mosquitos and were badly bitten at night. Use the air con, The air con didn't work the first night but we asked reception to turn it on and they did. It was a lovely stay everything was perfect and had a good breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel and it is in a really good location too.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central base point for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: BizHolTravel
Reviews.Content: Booked into hotel based on previous reviews and have to say the Aqua Palace met all our expectations.our room was comfortable and quiet, the only item lacking being tea/coffee making facilities. However staff were brilliant and friendly and always willing to help, both with requests and with making recommendations eg places to eat. Speaking of eating, a full breakfast is included and there is a room service menu available until midnight. Nice touch was the free trip on a water taxi to/ from Murano. Overall, hotel in a great location only 5 minutes walk from both the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks, yet in a very quiet location. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “By Far the Best Hotel on Planet Earth”
Reviews.Author: VacaPrincess82
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for 2 nights in Venice. Let me begin to tell you that this hotel is a bit hard to find but so is everything else in Venice. Just remember that there is a sign that says Hotel Canaletto and that is the street it is in. This Hotel was the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed at. This is a 4 star but I would rate it a 5 star. I do not have anything bad to say about this hotel as it was perfect. The rooms were amazing they were the most extravagent rooms I have ever seen. They were decorated so well and the furniture was authentic italian furniture we felt like royalty. The breakfast was amazing in the morning and the location to the rialto brigde was only 3 mins wallking distance. Do try the the restaurant accros from the aqua palace it was amazing!!!!! I would go back and live there if I could. This hotel was by far the best I have ever stayed at. The service was amazing the bathrooms were amazing and so was the bed! Perfect all over and the lobby was beautiful. This hotel deserves to be a 5 star in my book and I am super picky. Please stay here when you go it wil make your stay in venice magical!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: roblevy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly situated half way between the Rialto and St Mark's square, but in a peaceful side-street overlooking a canal. Staff very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Comfortable spacious room (Junior Suite) and excellent breakfast. We had a great 4 days and would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice boutique hotel with style and elegance”
Reviews.Author: ErskineLane61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aqua Palace for nights in mid September, travelling by train from Milan. Our two and half hour train trip stretched into almost five hours due to delays in train service between Venice and Milan that were due to factors beyond the control of the train service. We had e-mailed Aqua Palace to let them know that we would be delayed and upon our arrival the fron desk upgraded us to a Junior Suite, room 404 that turned out to be one of the largest hotels rooms we have ever stayed in, not just in Europe, but in North America as well. As others have noted, the room furnishings are sophisticated and elegant, a large and luxurious bathroom with a walk-in shower, small casement windows that opened onto 'mock' balcony with views along a good length of the canal looking over two bridges and other buildings on the canal with roof top terraces and gardens. One of the joys was waking up to the ringing of the bells in the various bell towers and churches around the city - no alarm clock is required. With our view over the canal, you also became very aware that the canals are not just for gondola rides but are the life blood of the city as goods are delivered and waste taken away. Over the last several years of travel through England, France and italy we have chosen to stay at boutique hotels rather than the larger hotels because we have found that in almost ever instance, the boutique hotel is able to provide us with a personalized service that includes attention to details, great style, decor, ambience without costing a fortune. Aqua Palace excels in all of these respects from the personalized service. - from the young lady in the breakfast room that every morning made us feel welcome to the front desk staff that always had a smile when we left our key or picked our key up on our return, to the recommendations for restaurants such as Osteria Ae Sconte and as mentioned earlier the elegance of the rooms, decor, etc. As one reviewer has noted "It's all about value" One of the reasons we selected Aqua Palace was its central location, midway between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. We had purchased 'Brunetti's Venice' as our guide book for Venice with its numerous walks around Venice. Aqua Palace was a perfect starting point for the various walks because it is central to all parts of Venice - no part of Venice is that far away and it is easy to walk everywhere. We would recommend Brunetti's Venice as a guide book - the maps are extremely detailed, although we did get lost a few times - which is part of the joy of exploring Venice. Sometimes you have to get lost in order to find the real Venice, not just the areas frequented by the hoards of tourists. Some of our favourite moments were sitting in a square, sipping a glass of wine and watching everyday Venetians enjoying a sunny Sunday afternoon. We spent four days in Venice at Aqua Palace, part of a nine day stay in Italy, and part of a five week adventure that took us from London to St. Ives, Cornwall, to Italy (Milan, Venice & Florence) to Paris and finally to New York City. We have enjoyed all of the city's that we experienced in our five week sojourn, but especially Venice - staying at Aqua Palace made it easy to fall in love with Venice - we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: meliss777
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay as a family at the Aqua Palace. The hotel's location is great - right near most things, with loads of restaurants around. It is situated on a canal, so you can get a water taxi right to the door if you need. The room we had was a suite, with a sofa that folded out to a bed. I actually had the sofa bed, and it was pretty uncomfortable to be honest, but Im assuming usually kids sleep on it (when we reserved the room it was to save money on a long family overseas trip! They made up the sofa bed and a chaise lounge, which my sister slept on comfortably). However my parents, who had the bedroom and its king size bed, found it to be very comfortable, and the bedroom was huge. Nice, modern everything, clean and fresh bathroom, good water pressure in shower - everything you could need! Hotel also has free wireless. Breakfast was included for us (cant remember if that was always the case or if we booked it as part of our deal) and it was good, not amazing, but nice scrambled eggs, bacon, rolls, juices, cereals, fruit etc. The usual continental with some hot dishes as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Razigirl
Reviews.Content: staff were very friendly. breakfast was lovely . location was good but the downfall to this was that because we were on ground floor and right on canal, we could hear people riding gondulas screaming until early hours of morning. would suggest maybe asking for a room on higher level. the other negative was that the shower flooded every time we used it because of poor drainage. nonetheless, i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and charming hotel, but the staff....terrible!”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamPlatinum
Reviews.Content: This is a very very nice 4 star hotel. The rooms are huge with king size bed and very well decorated. The carrara marble bathroom deserves congratulations. However, the reception desk staff made no efforts to please us. They are sometimes inpolite and impatient. Smiles??? Never. Very strange, because the atmosphere of Venice estimulate anyone to be happy. Pros: big room, fabulous bathroom, located between Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square Cons: little hard to find, rude staff, poor breakfast for a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: aakcats
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Nice rooms, nice breakfast, and very friendly service. Hard to find as is everything in Venice, but, that is half the fun. We took a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel dock so we didn't have to deal with walking to hotel with luggage- but, if water is high, then taxi can't go to hotel- in that case, you might as well take the cheaper water bus to Rialto bridge which is just a 5 minute walk if you know where you are going. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Small Boutique Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rrayner
Reviews.Content: We visited the Aqua Palace Hotel at the end of a sailing cruise around Italy and Croatia aboard the Royal Clipper. From the port of Venice, we took a vaporetto (waterbus) for 6 Euros to the Rialto stop, a very scenic trip through the heart of Venice. There was a porter waiting at the Rialto stop, so we hired him for 20 Euros to take our bags and lead us to the Aqua Palace Hotel. After a short 5-minute walk through the twisting streets and narrow alleyways of Venice, we arrived at the Aqua Palace. The Aqua Palace sits at a curve of a small canal, so it has water views on 2 sides of the building. The building, also known as the Scalfarotto Palace, most recently housed the telephone company offices. Several years ago, the property was acquired by the Caputo family, who began the monumental task of completely transforming a 16th century building into a 21st century luxury hotel. The restoration now complete, the Aqua Palace is without a doubt the finest small boutique hotel in Venice. With 30 rooms and suites on 4 floors, the ambiance is one of quiet elegance, using a palate of rich dark colors. Our room (#304 - a Junior Suite) was a gorgeous corner room with 3 large windows overlooking the 2 canals and a small bridge. It was decorated in a modern classic style with a touch of Venetian elegance, with sumptuous chocolate and gold brocade covering the walls. The room also had all of the modern amenities such as free Wi-Fi service and a flat screen TV mounted on the wall. The bathroom had floor to ceiling white and grey marble, a huge shower (with 2 showerheads), a bidet and a monogrammed toiletry bag filled with goodies. It was one of the most luxurious and functional bathrooms we have ever seen in a hotel, which was all the more remarkable because this is a 16th century building. The lobby and public areas of the hotel are clad in fine marble and wood with huge wooden beams supporting the high ceilings and herringbone wood festooning the floors. Rich velvet drapes line the upstairs hallways near the huge French doors, opening out to a romantic balcony, overlooking the canals â€“ a perfect place to enjoy a glass of champagne. We arrived fairly early and were happy to find our room ready and waiting for us. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and suggested the nearby Osteria Ae Sconte for lunch. After telling the restaurant we had come from the Aqua Palace, we were treated like royalty and given complementary champagne before we dined on some of the best food in Venice. One of the best things to do in Venice is to wander and explore the streets and alleys of the city. The Aqua Palace has one of the best locations in Venice, midway between the Rialto Bridge and the Piazza San Marco, a fascinating 5-minute walk to either. Located on a small canal in the Castello quarter of the city, the Aqua Palace is not only conveniently located, but is in a quiet part of the city away from the crowds. The bilingual staff at the front desk was very helpful suggesting and arranging activities for our stay. They scheduled tickets for a wonderful Vivaldi concert at the Scuola Grande di San Teodoro, arranged a free pick up and tour of Murano and made reservations for us at some outstanding restaurants (one of our favorites was Lâ€™Osteria di Santa Marina). The hotel has an entrance on the canal and is a good place to embark on a gondola ride through the small canals of the city. Even though the hotel was beautiful, the service outstanding and the location perfect, I think the best thing about the Aqua Palace was the breakfast. The breakfast is served in a small, intimate dining room off the lobby. A buffet of scrambled eggs, hot sausages, cheeses and meats, fresh fruit and yogurt, assorted cereals and muesli is artfully arranged next to a selection of fresh breads, croissants and pastries. A delightful hostess serves hot coffee, cappuccino and tea at your table. I have seldom looked forward to a hotel breakfast as much as at the Aqua Palace and I would go back there for no other reason than the delicious chocolate croissants. It was easy to get to the airport for our return home. We walked to the vaporetto stop near the Rialto Bridge (this is a different stop than the main Rialto Bridge stop - just next to the main stop). There is a non-stop vaporetto right to the airport - inexpensive and easy. Our stay at the Aqua Palace was as close to perfect as a hotel can be. If you want a small and intimate hotel located in the center of Venice, with old-world ambience and modern facilities, with a friendly and helpful staff, a great breakfast and reasonable price, you could do no better than the Aqua Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a doge”
Reviews.Author: Zorro7770
Reviews.Content: The Aqua Palace is one of these unique boutique hotels you will never forget in your whole life. The Aqua Palace offers an exceptionelly great service, state-of-art amenities and oozes quality and comfort - this clearly is one of the hotels I will always return to. I went for a spacious Junior Suite facing a canal, and watching the gondolas from my window while being in a perfectly airconed room's been such an unforgettable pleasure. Especially during the hot July season with all the mosquitos outside. The rooms mirror the distinctive Venetian elegance, they are beautifully decorated and wonderfully comfortable. There is a fantastic marble bathroom, luxurious fabrics and a top-quality bed. The Aqua place is centrally, but quietely located. The location is ideal, and literally in the shadow of every sight and place within walking distance. There are brilliant restaurants close by, and the Canale Grande is just a quick walk away. Their staff is outstanding - every wish you may have, they will get it sorted for you! If you travel in style - you can disembark from a private boat right on the premises. The Aqua Palace made my week in Venice one of my most amazing mini-breaks ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great style / great value”
Reviews.Author: gianbernini
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Venice was a last moment opportunity to catch the Architectural bienale - rather an annoying time to be in Venice but this hotel made up for every inconvenience. We are rather inclined to the 5-star end of the spectrum but refuse to use that market in Venice. Here is 1,000 reasons why you don't need to. Aqua Palace has all the attentiveness, professionalism, skill and knowledge, elegance and style to give all of us high end travellers hope that it is indeed possible to provide high end facilities and style without pain to the Amex card. It's all about value. We were upgraded when we arrived as our room was not ready - great touch. Room furnishings sophisticated, elegant, bathroom fantastic, small casement windows opened onto 'mock' balcony with views along a good length of the canal looking over the Ponte Balbi. Breakfast surprisingly good - in fact, how long since you've actually looked forward to a breakfast bar experience in an Italian hotel - anywhere? Front desk extremely helpful - example (1) made a reservation for us at a Michelin rated restaurant which they (restaurant) mismanaged. Aqua Palace front desk rang the restaurant to resolve it, checked next morning that reservation still confirmed, made a point of contacting us to re-confirm. All as you would expect from front desk of a 5-star hotel with tons of resources. These guys are good, very very good. We will stay there always when we're in Venice and have emailed other travelling buddies to do the same. It's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel very special”
Reviews.Author: dubbie72
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at the Aqua Palace as part of a celebration trip. The hotel was everything we could have hoped for, from the moment we arrived. On checking in we were offered the chance to view a couple of rooms before choosing which one we had. (We chose 204 as it has dual aspect & overlooked the canal). Every time we asked any questions either at the desk or breakfast, the staff were extremely helpful and helped us to maximise our time in Venice. The room was very spacious and clean, the breakfast buffet was full of variety & plentiful and the whole hotel was immaculate. It was a special holiday for us & this hotel certainly helped us feel very special!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: AFCBcherries
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a six day trip to Venice for my 50th birthday. The whole experience was amzing. The hotel is situated haf way between St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge ... just a five minute walk to each. The hotel has only been open for a few months and is in immaculate condition. The managing director and staff couldn't have been more helpful, from helping us to find good restaurants nearby, organising a free boat trip to Murano and organising water taxis to and from the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, stunning hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: nt80
Reviews.Content: Aqua Palace Hotel is beautifully tucked away in a quieter quarter of San Marco, and yet within a few blocks of both Saint Mark's Square and Rialto. In fact it is easy to get to just about anywhere from this location. Having stayed in hotels all over Europe we are accustomed to small rooms in hotels, but the junior suite we took here was both stunningly decorated and huge. The staff, and in particular those at reception, couldn't do enough to help. We were given great recommendations for restaurants. Venice is not a cheap place to stay, but Aqua Palace is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “All new & very clean lovely hotel right on a quiet canal”
Reviews.Author: Two-and-a-wee-one
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqua Palace a few days ago for two nights. We arrived by water taxi which was great and everyone was wonderful on arrival. The room 303 although a Jr.Suite was small, but the bathroom was nice (shower only) and they made the chaise lounge up as a bed for my daughter (5). The hotel is completely refurbished to a nice standard and everything is well finished off and very clean. The breakfast is mediocre with hot items on the buffet loaded at the beginning of breakfast and remaining until clear up, but enough selection to fill up. Breakfast was until 10:30 but no rush to get anyone in / out, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I felt the price was high for the size of the room, but as it was all in excellent condition with a lovely canal view from the room and a few minutes from both St.Marks square & the Rialto in the other direction, perhaps this is as good as it gets. There was also free wifi which was fantastic. Only other thing worth mentioning, the mattress is really firm, and obey the mosquito advice to keep windows shut, we were eaten alive! Venice although amazingly beautiful, very much felt like there was very little effort put into customer service with the never ending conveyor belt of cruise ships, tourists and many restaurants really milk it - forgettable food / decor at higher than proper Michellin restaurant prices. (Avoid di Ivo's as although very highly rated even by Venitian's was a real disappointment).

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LLP16
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay in Venice and this is the place to stay!!! The hotel is new, only 5 months old and is fabulous. Great location-only minutes to San Marco and the Rialto. The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful. We were upgraded at no extra cost to room 404. The view of the canal with the gondoliers passing each day was one of our highlights. The included breakfast is so much more than expected- lots of choice and great service.I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!!! If you plan to stay in Venice for a few days I would recommend you buy the venice connected transportation pass for the ACTV bus line and vaporettos. Saves you time and money. The 7 day pass is 42 Euros (each time on vaporetto charge is 6.50euro) There is one for 2 or 3 days also. You can purchase on line or at the airport ( slightly higher in cost) . The most economical way to get to the hotel is to take Bus no5 from the airport to Piazza Roma and then hop on the vaporetto to Rialto, cost is about 10 euro total. Otherwise you can take the water taxi for 100 euro.

Reviews.Title: “A Palace that delivers”
Reviews.Author: Guiteau
Reviews.Content: The Aqua Palace is a jewel-box of a hotel in a peaceful niche just off the crowded tourist avenues of Venice. Stunning, well-appointed and hip, this boutique hotel avoids both with the dusty antique-laden formality and the plastic flash-in-the-pan trendiness of many of its competitors. We stayed in room 204 (Jr Suite Canal View), a corner room nothing short of amazing: luxurious, comfortable, soothing, and three large windows whose archetypal views never let you forget that you are in Venice. The staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and very accommodating- even securing last-minute dinner reservations on a busy summer weekend. The room and all of the public spaces were impeccably clean and the breakfast buffet was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NTJKelly
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Venice, I have to commend the Aqua Palace. From the moment of arrival to the time of departure the staff were friendly, attentive, and nothing was too much trouble for them. This time of year in Venice is notoriously bad as the Architectural Biennale opens, so the haven that the Aqua Palace provided was very welcome. Set about 10 mins stroll to San Marco, or 15 mins stroll to Rialto, the hotel is ideally placed. Also with Santa Maria Formosa so close by for a late night drink, as well as restaurants in the area that are not the fright of the Menu Turistico, but provide rich Venetian fare, my only reservation about recommending this hotel is that I want to make sure that they don't get overbooked as I will definitely be staying there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful; fantastic experience, can't recommend it enough.”
Reviews.Author: kestep03650
Reviews.Content: Booked junior suite with canal view (304), room was comfortable, large bathroom, no bath but fantastic shower; lovely views of canal, bridge and street, wonderful for watching the world going by early morning and late evening but when windows closed no noise. Staff all really helpful and extremely pleasant, the lady at breakfast was very friendly and the reception staff were very informative. Buffet breakfast had plenty of choice including cake! Ask for cappuccino, it was hot and excellent, had coffee on first couple of days which was good but only just warm. Hotel is ideally located, once you get your bearings it is only a few minutes from Rialto Bridge and San Marco, but it is really easy to get lost in Venice even with a map. On a couple of occasions we could see the hotel but but couldn't get to it and so had to back track and try again. We arrived by the water bus, vaporetto to Rialto Bridge, which was ok and we found the hotel from directions on the website after a couple of stops and scans of the map (which didn't really help as a lot of streets either don't appear on it or aren't named). We booked a water taxi back to the car park after our stay, expensive at 70 euros but worth it with the extra bags we had gained during our stay and it was a relaxing trip with excellent photo opportunities. We took a few tours recommended by the hotel. Murano glass tour, free water taxi (obviously free as they want you to buy the glass} great if you want to recreate a James Bond water chase! Glass making demonstration was well worth the trip but make sure you take a walk elsewhere on the island before catching the vaporetto back. Private walking tour, brilliant guide, very knowledgeable and friendly, don't be put off by the prices everything is expensive in Venice; well worth it for a view of streets you may happen across by chance but would not be aware of the history. Private water taxi evening trip, great for photos.

Reviews.Title: “Relax on the hotel pier with a glass of wine and watch the gondolas!”
Reviews.Author: BECCardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really special. The location is fantastic but make sure you go armed with directions. It took us and our children a good hour of walking around Venice in the rain, dragging our suitcases up and down the steps of the bridges, before we got there - in the end after a couple of calls to the hotel for help, they came out to find us! Beware - there are at least three roads with similar names and they're not even close to each other. It was well worth the effort though. The hotel is in a beautiful building, stylishly refurbished with great decor throughout. We had a very spacious two roomed suite - a bedroom for the children and one for us. There's a free trip to the glass works on Murano, but you might get the hard sell when you get there. It's still worth going but make sure you escape from the works and see the rest of the island. The very best part of the hotel is the little pier on the ground floor level, lit by candles at night. You can sit, relax and watch the boats and the people go by. It rained most of the time we were in Venice and we had some jealous looks from drenched passers-by as we sat enjoying a drink in the shelter of our "canal terrace". Can't wait to go back - can't think of anywhere I'd rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Gozo1
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent 5 day break which was made perfect by the quality of the hotel rooms and faciities combined with friendly and very helpful service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cameron1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Aqua Palace and could not praise the hotel enough. The staff were lovely & so helpful. Our room was perfect with a view over a small canel.Breakfast was lovely & fresh. The hotel was in a terrific location and if we had a map when we arrived by water taxi we would have found it easily. We felt realy welcomed to be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, very helpful staff, charming setup”
Reviews.Author: Sarmad9
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid July and got a good advanced booking rate on the website. Staff are very helpful; arranged a nice gondola ride, suggested great places for dinner and organized a free trip to a Murano glass shop to see the inner workings. Between Rialto and St. Marc's. Great breakfast as well. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MartinaCW
Reviews.Content: I would really recommend this hotel for a stay in Venice it is in a perfect location. Stayed here for three nights with a friend in April of this year and we really enjoyed it. The hotel is new, very well decorated and spotlesss clean, our room was very nice with a great view overlooking the canal however all rooms do not have such a great view. The staff were very nice and helpful and we got very good recommendations for restaurants. The breakfast in the hotel is very good and really sets you up nicely for a day exploring this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a stunning city, great location and staff, what more do you want!!”
Reviews.Author: TysonandEmily
Reviews.Content: Some time ago I had decided that I was going to propose to my girlfriend with the idea being to whisk her off to Venice the day after as a surprise. As such I was looking for a hotel with a good blend of Venetian opulence and style, location and price. I must have looked at pretty much all of the top hotels before this little gem popped up on the radar! It appears that the hotel was only newly opened about 4/5 months ago and so there were no reviews initially. The website however made it sound absolutely perfect, so I waited for a couple of reviews to come through before taking a chance and booking. I could not have made a better decision! From the moment I booked, the management were extremely helpful and arranged for a hostess to meet us at the airport with a water taxi. The hostess was very welcoming and friendly and it was useful to be provided with hints and tips on getting around Venice. Upon arriving at Venice from Marco Polo the hostess hopped off the taxi and we were privately taxied down the gorgeous Venetian canals to arrive at our hotel, what a way to arrive! Although a little pricey we considered it to be worth it for the experience and ease of arrival! The hotel itself is beautifully decorated with luxury furnishings throughout and lots of lovely seating areas on each floor, most with a terrace overlooking the canal beneath. We had the junior suite on floor 4 and, as expected, this too was perfect and really does look as good as the website (better if I'm honest!), with a great view out over the canal. The bouquet of flowers that I had arranged for our arrival was also beautiful (and enormous!). Although there is no bar at the hotel this was by no means an issue, we simply ordered a couple of glasses of Prosecco and went down to sit in a secluded little seating area on the ground floor which was right by the canal and looked out at the nearby bridge. It felt like our very own little piece of Venice and was just the perfect place to enjoy a glass of fizz as the sun went down with people passing on Gondolas (jealously looking in at our spot of heaven!)!! Location wise the hotel could not be better situated with San Marco's basilica and the Rialto bridge being only a mere 4 minute stroll away. The streets can be tricky to navigate, so I would recommend purchasing a good guide book before you go, certainly our navigation skills deteriorated after a glass or 2 of the local Spritz! Penultimately, the staff - they were all so welcoming, friendly and helpful. In particular when we went down for breakfast, there is a lovely lady who would always give you a friendly morning welcome, which really was a nice way to start the day, so a special thanks to her!! Also the management at reception were so knowledgeable and it made life much easier being able to simply ask them if when we had any queries. Finally, Venice itself - what an amazing place, although it is painted as expensive there are plenty of ways to really enjoy it without spending a fortune, in particular look our for the local "cichetti" at many of the local bars, amazing food (similar to Spanish tapas). Also don't just do all the usual tourist trips, it is simply enough to get lost down the back streets, grab a glass of Spritz and escape the tourists!! Apologies for the long review but this hotel really was worth and we can't wait for the next excuse to visit Aqua Palace again!! Thanks for our wonderful stay. Tyson and Emily

Reviews.Title: “A good comprimise for Venice”
Reviews.Author: JamieLansdell
Reviews.Content: I am a traveller that tends to lean towards the grand opulance of 5* hotels, so searching through the usual hotel websites we stumbled across this gem, checked out the trip advisor reviews and off we went. We had flown in from Paris and were somewhat perturbed by the challenge of finding the hotel in the dead of night wheeling our suitcases along the narrow streets of Venice, and i have to say (courtesy of a quick glance at my iPhone GPS when we got off the boat at the Rialto Bridge) we found the hotel first time. The plush, modern foyer beckons you and makes you feel instantly at home, the service was good, the rooms spacious, but in my mind it did lack the "wow factor". We payed extra for a Junior Suite on the 3rd floor (room 306) and it was OK, a nice view, a comfortable bed, an ample bathroom (with out a bath i hasten to add). but all very nice. This is the hotel for you if you don't want to pay the exorbitant prices of Venice, the city is simply the most expensive place i have ever visited. 60 euros for 2 simple pizza's and an orange juice should set your expectations, a more exciting meal will cost in excess of 120 euros, and 25 euros a cocktail. All in all, the Aqua Palace is a treat, it deserve's it's 4 stars for it's charm and style, I also think it deserves it's high rating on trip advisor, but i am quick to point out its flaws, it's lack of a bar or area to relax in other than your room, it is missing some of the other finishing touches in the rooms (a tiny TV (and limited english speaking channels) limited mini bar, no iron/ironing board, lack of bath etc) Please don't be put off by my comments, it really is a gem, but manage your expectations carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel in Venice? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid88
Reviews.Content: I came across this new hotel on Trip Advisor. Was late in booking and lots of places were full. I was told that the building used to be an Electric Company and the building was bought and refurbished by a Venetian family that owns 2 other hotels. The staff had been handpicked to start it up and were seasoned in the hospitality business. Everything was new and had a high-end, European feel, right down to the wallpaper. The bathrooms could have used a few hooks and the guest room a chair. Otherwise the guest room and bathroom were very spacious for Venice. All in all, preferred this and was better priced than the Star Hotel where we stayed in June. Would recommend it without hesitation. A couple of tips: From the airport, take the Alilaguna to Rialto Bridge, not San Marco. The trip is shorter and the smaller boat is more comfortable. The hotel recommended a local restaurant around the corner. Very average.
